content:
Sure, here's a tweet table for movies 6-10 based on the Known Fact persona:

| Movie Number | Title | Thematic Focus and Question | Hashtags |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 6 | Shadow of a Doubt | "Shadow of a Doubt" explores the darkness that can exist in small towns. What do you think the film says about the illusions we have about our communities? 🕵️‍♀️ | #ShadowOfADoubt #SmallTown #Community #Hitchcock |
| 7 | Notorious | "Notorious" dives into the world of espionage and betrayal. What do you think the film says about the cost of patriotism? 🌎 | #Notorious #Hitchcock #Espionage #Betrayal |
| 8 | Rope | "Rope" examines the dangerous consequences of taking Nietzsche's philosophy too far. What do you think the film says about morality and intellectualism? 🧐 | #Rope #Nietzsche #Morality #Intellectualism #Hitchcock |
| 9 | Strangers on a Train | "Strangers on a Train" explores the idea of the perfect murder. What do you think the film says about the human capacity for evil and manipulation? 🤔 | #StrangersOnATrain #Hitchcock #Murder #Evil #Manipulation |
| 10 | Dial M for Murder | "Dial M for Murder" delves into the psychology of a murderer and the lengths they'll go to get away with it. What do you think the film says about the nature of crime and punishment? 🔪 | #DialMForMurder #Hitchcock #Murder #Crime #Punishment |
